page.title: 01GEOG & GEOL.
page.content: The block consists of a{plateau} which is around 350ft maximum altitude.The eastern half of the block is mainly sea, with the coast running NNE-SSW.The plateau is deeply dissected by E-W running valleys.These valleys contain small brooks which run east to the coast.The coast itself is mainly of shingle,with{Hogbacks} between Torcross and Bee Sands,and also between Bee Sands and Hall Sands. {The Solid Geology}of the area is mainly of Lower Devonian Sandstone, with some Diabase intrusions running E-W in the north of the block.To the centre of the block are some local grits, called Beeson Grits.In the south of the area are Hornblendic and Chloritic Schists,as well as Quartz- Mica Schists.In the valley bottoms ...
